explanations.a: Incorrect. log100 = log(10^2) = 2log10, not just log10.
explanations.b: Correct. log100 = log(10^2) = 2log10, using the logarithm power rule.
explanations.c: Incorrect. log1000 = log(10^3) = 3log10, which is not equivalent to log100.
explanations.d: Incorrect. log100 is not equal to 0; log1 = 0.

questions.question: 2. If each element of the array is traversed N (size of the array) times, what is the time complexity of the algorithm?

explanations.a: Incorrect. O(N) would be the complexity if each element is visited only once.
explanations.b: Correct. If each of the N elements is traversed N times, the total operations are N * N = N^2, giving O(N^2) time complexity.
explanations.c: Incorrect. O(2N) simplifies to O(N) in asymptotic notation, which does not account for nested traversals.
explanations.d: Incorrect. O(N^3) would require three nested loops over N elements.

answers.a: Array has O(1) lookup time complexity
answers.b: The elements of an array are stored contiguously in memory
answers.c: Array can be used to implement stacks & queues

explanations.a: Incorrect. While this is true, it is not the complete answer as options b and c are also correct.
explanations.b: Incorrect. While this is true, it is not the complete answer as options a and c are also correct.
explanations.c: Incorrect. While this is true, it is not the complete answer as options a and b are also correct.
explanations.d: Correct. All the given statements are true: arrays have O(1) lookup time, store elements contiguously, and can implement stacks and queues.

questions.question: 4. What is the complexity of searching a number in an unsorted array?

explanations.a: Correct. In an unsorted array, linear search is required, checking each element sequentially until the target is found or the array ends, giving O(N) complexity.
explanations.b: Incorrect. O(N^2) would involve nested iterations, which is not needed for simple searching.
explanations.c: Incorrect. O(NlogN) is typically associated with efficient sorting algorithms, not searching in unsorted arrays.
explanations.d: Incorrect. O(N^3) would involve triple nested loops, which is far too complex for a search operation.

questions.question: 5. Space complexity refers to the amount of memory taken by the algorithm in asymptotic notation.

explanations.a: Correct. Space complexity measures the amount of memory an algorithm uses as a function of input size, expressed in asymptotic notation.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Space complexity is about memory usage, not time.
